Chapter1.Additional Information: A stand with a book and mechanical hand.

Chapter1.Can be Found: Outside the Bar. Turn left from Police Station
Chapter1.Additional Information: Either the standing wooden sign or the hanging sign.

Chapter1.Can be Found: The back of Cedrics Shop, under the white cloth
Chapter1.Additional Information: It's a wooden barrel.
It's a bed.

Chapter1.Can be Found: Sheriff Blinkhorn is wearing it. Required by tutorial
Chapter1.Additional Information: It's a belt.
It's a bench. With wooden slats and metal railings. Try outside City Hall.
A pair of binoculars on the counter near the main entrance.
The large yellow and orange train with three coaches that you travel in.

Chapter1.Can be Found: Parked at the pier at Palm Brinks Lake
Chapter1.Additional Information: It's a small wooden boat.

Chapter1.Can be Found: Dell Clinic, by Palm Brinks Lake
Chapter1.Additional Information: The standing skeleton model.

Chapter1.Can be Found: One in Mortons Sundries, on Counter
Chapter1.Additional Information: A book or stack of books.

Chapter1.Can be Found: A common item, try the Bar
Chapter1.Additional Information: Any bottle will do.
The loaves of bread sticking out of the baskets.
The small stone bridge over the tiny river.

Chapter1.Can be Found: Opposite the Bar by the Station in Palm Brinks
Chapter1.Additional Information: The little wooden sign by the Tea Shop.
On one of the shelves.
One of the candles lining the aisle.
Being used as the serving counter.

Chapter1.Can be Found: Next to Cedrics Shop, before Police Station
Chapter1.Additional Information: A wooden cart with large wheels.
Either the price board on the side of the stairs, or the hanging sign.
It's a wooden chair.
Main lobby, hanging from ceiling.
These can also be constucted in Georama.

Chapter1.Can be Found: Above the Train Station or City Hall
Chapter1.Additional Information: A clock.
The white cloths you'll see scattered about.
The pad upon which Steve the Ridepod is standing.

After entering the station, look alongg left wall. You'll see a shop and a 
bar. The cup can be seen at the bar.
The curtains on his window.
The antlers decorating the walls.
The duck shaped sign hanging up over the stairs.
The large bridge spanning the river.
A set of drawers.
The wardrobe.
Look on a shelf high up. You'll see an egg in a nest.
Hanging over Geralds bed.

The Sun during the evening. Listen for the bell in Palm Brinks. (Lake is 
best place to get clear shot)
A large glass eye.
Near the top of the stairs.
A metal fence.
The sculptures of women.
Geralds Room. The large open fireplace.
On the table, a large fish.
The little yellow and orange flags strung up across the street.
Up the stairs to the top. Look on the desk.
The decorative items either side of the door.
A large fountain.
On one of the tracks over to the right.
The metal gate at the end of the pathway to the front door.

Chapter1.Can be Found: Mayor Needs Office in City Hall
Chapter1.Additional Information: A display case with pairs of glasses inside.
Next to Show Window in wall.
Look for the gardening tool propped up near the pumpkin patch.

When you emerge out of the Underground Water Channel, take a picture of one 
of the bridges.

On the lower floor of the Weapon Shop, you'll see a large metal cabinet. 
Get a picture of it.
There are ladders in Parns place. Get a pic of one of them.
The blue lamps on the wall.
On the desk up the stairs will be a letter.
The blue light on the ceiling.
One outside the Weapon Shop.

Get a pic of the Manhole next to Cedrics Shop that leads to the Underground 
Water Channel.
Outside Pollys Bakery
The tall white structure you see as you head towards lake.

As night fades you'll hear a bell if your in Palm Brinks signalling 
Morning. Catch a picture of the rising Sun. The lake would be a good place.
The pumpkin outside Mortons Sundries with the sign sticking out of it.
The little robot right next to the door.
The oven behind the counter.
The painting of Parn and Julia.
The cans of paint.
In the corridor leading to kitchen, one of the plants there.
The umbrellas over tables. Look near main river.
The sign for Parns Art Studio.

When you enter and go up the short stairs into the room, the phone is below 
the camera angle at the top of those stairs.

Chapter1.Can be Found: Mayor Needs Office in City Hall
Chapter1.Additional Information: The gramaphone near the hourglass clock.
In the corner of the lobby of Maxs house, or in the Bar.
The pier on the lake where you find Fabio.
Cedrics Shops roof. The lower half.
The sign above the Police Station
The board or Sunshade outside the Bakery.
One of the large metal posts outside Cedrics Shop.
A small pot to right of fireplace.
Outside Mortons Shop or his house.
The railway tracks
The trumpet/horn thing near the entrance.
The large refridgerator just up the stairs.
Any shop wil do. Take a picture of the cash register.
On the wall above the door.
The main river the Drawbridge crosses.
A robot he was working on.
Near the Lake
The carpet lining the main aisle.
Behind where Doctor Dell stands.
On the shelf.
Next to Gold Store in wall.
Beneath most windows.
The small blank signs hanging from many buildings.
Look above the front door.
The main staircase.

Chapter1.Can be Found: Mayor Needs Office in City Hall
Chapter1.Additional Information: The lamp on his desk.
The open fireplace.
There's one between Cedrics Shop and the Police Station.
Above every door.
On the lower floor where you find the Scoop Memo and Camera.
The telescope pointing towards the window.
Look up at night and get a picture of the moon.
Look up in the afternoon and get a picture of the bright sun.
On the wall near the top of the stairs.
Above the large drawbridge.
Outside Cedrics Shop.
You'll find trees all over the place.
The Vacuum Max works on during the prologue.

Near the back of the shop is a trashcan under a white cloth. Take a picture 
of it.

You'll see a large watermelon sticking out of the fridge. This can be used 
to get this one.
Next to door, on Maxs right as you enter.

After emerging from the Underground Water Channel, get a pic of the water 
gushing from the pipe.
One of the weapons in the boxes near the counter.
The pink emblem on the wall outside the Weapon Shop.
The tall set of scales near the door.
The flour sacks.
High on left wall.
On every building.
There are wooden boxes near the back

Chapter2.Additional Information: Easily spotted in the main engine.
The main furnace that powers the engine.
Construct a Fruit Tree and take a pic of the yellow fruit hanging from it.

Grass is constructable in Georama. but there are a few patches already in 
Sindain when you first arrive. Photograph one of the patches.
Hammock is strung up near back.

**Missable**The upper left shop. Take a picture of the sign. (get before

**Missable* *The shop up the ladder. (get before finishing chapter 7)

A bookshelf that looks like a tree truck.

Hanging from the Chinese Stand once it's constructed.

When  a Fishing Contest is available, take a picture of the sign above the

On the wall of the church near the door.
The gigantic tree.
The arch of pink lights over the entrance inside.
On the Chinese Stand.

Once the church is constructed, the emblem can be found either high up on

**Missable** Inside Weapon Shop. (get before finishing chapter 7)

**Missable** The symbol on the wall above Lao Chaos head. (get before

A constructable Georama item. Must be attached to a house.

You'll see Lins House as soon as you enter the valley. Just take a picture 
of the house from outside.
**Missable** Looks like a telescope. (get before finishing chapter 7)
**Missable** A round white food item. (get before finishing chapter 7)
On top of the Chinese Stand once it's constructed.

**Missable** The dragon pattern going around near the roof. (get before

The book on top of the alter.
The scale used to weigh fish.

**Missable** A cooked duck breast on the main counter. (get before

A special constructable Georama lamp. Must be attached to a house.

The flaming torches near Lins house.
The award podium in the Fishing Contest Tent.

A constructable Georama item. Must be attached to a house.

Take a picture of the banana on the table.

**Missable** By each computor in the smaller labs. (get before finishing

A glowing egg device on the right.

**Missable** The glowing pipes in the smaller labs. (get before finishing

Take a picture of the sign above the tent entrance.

**Missable** Main lab, large glowing columns with pipes. (get before

A constructable Georama item. It must be placed on top of an Iron House.

One of the constructable Georama items is a purple lamp. Build and place 
one, then get a picture of it.

In the water of Veniccio, you'll notice tiny blue lights. These are Luna 
Stone Shards. Take a picture of them.

**Missable** The projector hanging from the ceiling of the main lab. (get 
before finishing chapter 7)
The island in the middle of the race pool.

As soon as you enter Veniccio from the Train Station, look up on the cliffs 
opposite you.

**Missable** Structures standing in the water apart from the main 
foundations. Look over railing to see them. (get before finishing chapter 7)
A rotating cogwheel.

**Missable** A device on the wall of the main lab, large, circular, 
coloured yellow and purple.(get before finishing chapter 7)
A TV with static on screen.
Look to the ceiling.
The large Water Tanks around the far edges of the tent.

Look to where the Red Houses are on the cliff. You'll see a small windmill 
with them.
Construct the Windmill, then take a picture of the large Windmill Feathers.

**Missable** Main lab, attached to Futuron 800. (get before finishing 
chapter 7)

Chapter5.Additional Information:
**Missable** While embers are still raining down on Heim Rada, place a 
straw or wood Georama item, (Straw Shed for example) then leave the area

the Fire Squall is destroyed, you will no longer be able to get this Idea.

**Missable** Lining the Operations Room, or inside Paznos. (get before

**Missable** The string of pink lights. (get before finishing chapter 7)

**Missable** Look to the right. (get before finishing chapter 7)

**Missable** The elevators that are used to reach different floors of the 
workshop. (get before finishing chapter 7

you first arrive. You place the Georama item 'Mud' on the Geysers to get 
rid of them. If you get rid of all of them before you get the picture, you 
can no longer get it.
**Missable** A hammer behind the counter. (get before finishing chapter 7)
Get a picture of the Hot Springs.
A constructable georama item. Must be attached to a house.
Get a picture of Mount Gundor as it appears from Heim Rada.

Constructable Georama item. If you place it on a Geyser, both will vanish, 
but place it on flat ground and you'll have a pile of mud you can get a 
picture of.
**Missable** A rug on the floor. (get before finishing chapter 7)

**Missable** Once you board Paznos, the Pattern you need will be a small 
emblem above the main window. (get before finishing chapter 7)
A constructable Georama item. Must be attached to a house.

**Missable** The fans hanging from the ceiling. (get before finishing 
chapter 7)

**Missable** A little bottle of yellow liquid on the floor to the left 
after entering. (get before finishing chapter 7)

**Missable** You can find these dotted around, one near the Time Portal. 
They can be used to teleport to different areas of the workshop. Get a 
picture of one. (get before finishing chapter 7)

**Missable** The large protruding spikes coming from the third floor. (get 
before finishing chapter 7)

**Missable** The Blue lights. (get before finishing chapter 7)

Chapter8.Additional Information: Take a photo of the games final boss.
The crystals embedded in the walls.

Unmissable.Name: Burning Dragon Fire
Unmissable.Description:
You'll need to get a pic of a Dragons Fire Breath attack. Stand a shorrt 
distance away and perhaps agro it with your gun. when you see it about to 
breath fire, get ready and take the pic as it shoots. You will take damage 
so have some health items and Tasty Water available to cure the Thirst that 
Dragon Fire gives you.

Unmissable.Name: Spinning Ivanoff
Unmissable.Description:
Another that's bound to cause damage. Ivanoff are the large rock enemies 
that roll at you at high speed. Again, stand a short distance away, agro it 
if needed and take the pic as it comes rolling towards you.

Unmissable.Name: Charging Ram
Unmissable.Description:
Rams are the enemies with the large axes that you find early in Starlight 
Canyon. Same as the above two, snap a pic as it comes running towards you. 
If you're quick, you may be able to pick up the Ram before it hits you by 
holding  and pressing . After you put the camera away obviously.

Unmissable.Name: Changing Dog Statue
Unmissable.Description:
This one is tricky. The Dog Statues fold themselves into a cube when you 
move too far away from them, them unfold when you get close. You need to 
get a picture of one while it's folding or unfolding. One strategy is to 
stand far enough away, but close enough to be able to target it, then fire 
the gun at it. While the bullet is travelling, get the camera out and snap 
the pic while it's unfolding. You'll need to be quick.

Unmissable.Name: Faintin' Bone Lord
Unmissable.Description:
Bone Lord is first found in Mt Gundor. They're the large skeletal enemies 
with the massive sword. In order to stun one to get the picture, you'll 
need to throw, either one of the rocks that are scattered around if there 
are any, or maybe another throwable enemy. When the Bone Lord is dazed and 
has stars circling its head, get the picture.

Unmissable.Name: Night Stalker
Unmissable.Description:
Night stalkers are the purple cloaked mage like enemies. They throw fire, 
or do a spinning attack. You need to get the picture while it's doing a 
spinning attack. Don't stand too far away or it'll just throw fire. Get 
closer, just not TOO close.

Unmissable.Name: Dangerous Pumpkin
Unmissable.Description:
This one is pretty easy. The Pumpkin head enemies, when idle, sometimes 
spin their pitchforks around like a baton. Just get a picture of one doing 
that. Just watch out for the explosives they throw.

Unmissable.Name: Hurray for Rock Man
Unmissable.Description:
The giant Stone Golems first appear in Starlight Canyon. You can get this 
picture one of two ways. Either snap a pic of the idle animation where they 
pump their arms in the air, or when they raise their arms for a ground 
pound attack.

Unmissable.Name: Nice Massage
Unmissable.Description:
Look for the enemy called 'Priest of Rama'. There's an idle animation they 
sometimes do where it looks like they use their massive hands to give 
themselves a massage. Snap a picture of this humorous moment.

Unmissable.Name: Gyumos Yell
Unmissable.Description:
Gyumo looks like a large grey boar that can walk on 2 legs as well as run 
on 4. On occasion it will raise its head and call out with a distinctive 
yell. Get a picture of one doing that.

Unmissable.Name: Spooky Grass Smile
Unmissable.Description:
The Man Eating Grass has an idle animation that looks like it bounces its 
head slightly. Get a picture of one doing that.

Unmissable.Name: Barons Hangin' On
Unmissable.Description:
The Vanguard is a mech enemy being driven by a Baron Balloon. One of it's 
attacks is to push itself in the air, flip unside down and stomp on top of 
you. It only does this while close to you, so you will take damage. Get 
close and point your camera up. When he does the jump up, get the pic of 
the Baron Balloon upside down. Bring lots of healing items, or come back 
later when your defense is higher.

Unmissable.Name: Tores Nap
Unmissable.Description:
An easy one this. Tore looks like a large tree. They remain idle until you 
get close. Get a picture of an idle one as it sleeps.

Unmissable.Name: Face Behind Devil Mask
Unmissable.Description:
There are two ways to get this. When you find a Masked Tribeman, you can 
get close and wait for it to do it's bite attack, then get a picture of 
it's face through the open mouth, or throw something at it to daze it, and 
get a pic of it's face that way.

Unmissable.Name: Floatin' Earth Digger
Unmissable.Description:
This one is frustrating. You need to catch a picture of the Earth Digger in 
mid air as it jumps. These jumps are fast and unpredictable so it may take 
some time. Make sure to stay at least some distance from it. If you're too 
close you won't be able to get the picture before you get knocked off your 
feet.

Unmissable.Name: Bomber Head Boom
Unmissable.Description:
Another tricky one. When you find a Bomber Head, weaken it to about 10-30% 
of its HP, then wait for it to do it's suicide attack. It's head will 
expand and it will float towards you. Back away a bit then start snapping 
photos to catch it as it explodes.

Unmissable.Name: Master Utan
Unmissable.Location:
Rainbow Butterfly Wood
Fish Monster Swamp
Unmissable.Description:
You'll find Master Utan near the exit point of this floor. Just take a pic 
of him any time.

Unmissable.Name: Veniccio's Evening Sun
Unmissable.Description: Just like the 'Evening Sun' Idea, but this one is specifically in Veniccio.

Unmissable.Name: Ancient Mural
Unmissable.Location:
Oceans Roar Cave
Cave of Ancient Murals
Unmissable.Description:
Take a picture of the large mural on the wall. You can't miss it, it's the 
same as the one seen on the title screen.

Unmissable.Name: Lafrecia Stem
Unmissable.Description:
Take a photo of the giant Lafrecia Stem after blooming it. you can come 
here for the pic any time you want.

Unmissable.Name: Earth Gem Alter
Unmissable.Location:
Rainbow Butterfly Wood
Chamber of the Sleeping Earth Gem
Unmissable.Description:
After beating the Guardian, take a photo of the Alter. It doesn't matter if 
you do it before or after picking up the gem.

Unmissable.Name: Wind Gem Alter
Unmissable.Location:
Starlight Canyon
Chamber of the Defending wind Gem
Unmissable.Description:
After beating the Guardian, take a photo of the Alter. It doesn't matter if 
you do it before or after picking up the gem.

Unmissable.Name: Water Gem Alter
Unmissable.Location:
Oceans Roar Cave
Chamber  of the Sleeping Water Gem
Unmissable.Description:
After beating the Guardian, take a photo of the Alter. It doesn't matter if 
you do it before or after picking up the gem.

Unmissable.Name: Fire Gem Alter
Unmissable.Location:
Mt Gundor
Chamber of the Blazing Fire Gem
Unmissable.Description:
After beating the Guardian, take a photo of the Alter. It doesn't matter if 
you do it before or after picking up the gem.

Unmissable.Name: Lava Road
Unmissable.Description:
After using the Fire Horn that Galen Agaris gives you, take a picture of 
the path that opened up through the lava.

Unmissable.Name: Fallen Battleship
Unmissable.Description:
After crossing the Lava Road, you'll fight The Ultimate Gaspard (see 
Missable Scoop List) next to the Fallen Battleship. Take a picture of the 
wreck. If you miss it, you can come back to this floor any time.

Unmissable.Name: Ruler of the Pond
Unmissable.Description:
The first of the 3 Ghost Scoops. Visit Palm Brinks lake and after midnight, 
start taking pictures looking across the lake. In the brief moment of the 
camera shutter, you should see a white haze. Point your camera at it and 
 take the picture.

Unmissable.Name: A Surviving Soldier
Unmissable.Description:
The second of the Ghost scoops. In Veniccio, head out to sea as far as you 
can, so that Oceans Roar Cave is on the right, and look left. You should 
see a small tunnel. head inside it as far as you can and stick to the right 
wall. See that rock on the left? Aim your camera just behind that rock at 
some point after midnight and look for that white haze as you click the 
shutter.

Unmissable.Name: Hot Springs Spirit
Unmissable.Description:
The third Ghost Scoop. Go to the Hot Springs in Heim Rada around midnight, 
and as you descend the slope, the ghost will be on the right hand set of 
hot springs. Stand at the waters edge, and click the shutter while looking 
around, keeping an eye out for that familiar white haze.

Missable.Name: Brave Little Linda
Missable.Description: When Linda lifts her front legs for a stomp attack, snap the picture.
Missable.Point at which you missed it: As soon as you beat Linda.

Missable.Name: Clown Robos Attack
Missable.Description:
When the Robo opens it's eyes to shoot missiles. Get the pic of it's open 
eyes. (bring plenty of healing items just in case)
Missable.Point at which you missed it: When Clown Robo is defeated.

Missable.Name: Hmmmm! Jurak
Missable.Description: Just take a picture of Jurak once you've revived him.
Missable.Point at which you missed it: When you complete chapter 7. All future areas become inaccessable.

Missable.Name: King Marden
Missable.Location:
Rainbow Butterfly Wood
Fish Monster Swamp
Missable.Description: Take a picture of King Marden after fishing him up.
Missable.Point at which you missed it: After giving him the Priscleen fish. He won't appear again.

Missable.Name: Rainbow Butterfly Reunited
Missable.Description:
Attack the yellow strands in the middle of the flower and the Rainbow 
Butterfly will divide. You need to attack the small butterflies in order of 
color to beat the boss, so attack any except the red one. Take the pic when 
the Rainbow Butterfly is big again.
Missable.Point at which you missed it: After hitting the 7th butterfly following the correct color sequence.

Missable.Name: Find the Golden Egg
Missable.Description:
You need to restore Jurak Mall Georama to 100% to get the Golden Egg to 
appear. (one hidden Georama goal is to put a fence around the Firbits 
House, see  GeoraManiac for more info). The egg will be in a nest on a 
branch above you. Just take a pic of it.
Missable.Point at which you missed it: When you complete chapter 7.

Missable.Name: Phantom Memo Eater
Missable.Description:
After healing Lin she'll join your party (temporarily). When you bring her 
to Yordas Valley, the Phantom Memo Eater mini boss will appear. Take a 
picture of it.
Missable.Point at which you missed it: As soon as you beat it.

Missable.Name: Flying Battleship
Missable.Location:
Starlight Canyon Cape Lighthouse/Oceans Roar Cave Shigura Village/Mt Gundor 
Peak
Missable.Description:
You'll have 3 opportunities to take a picture of the Death Ark, Gaspards 
Flying Battleship. While defending Lin at the Lighthouse at the end of 
chapter 3, when fighting Doctor Jaming at the end of chapter 4, or when 
attacking the Death Ark mid way through chapter 5.
Missable.Point at which you missed it: As soon as you beat it at Mt Gundor, it'll fall.

Missable.Name: Moon Crystal
Missable.Description:
When you've completed Balance Valleys Georama to 100%, go into the future, 
and the Moon Crystal will be sitting at the top.
Missable.Point at which you missed it: When you complete chapter 7.

Missable.Name: Puppet Shingala
Missable.Location:
Oceans Roar Cave
Cave of Ancient Murals
Missable.Description:
When you first see Puppet Shingala, it'll be a cutscene. You won't get the 
chance for a pic until you come back with an Electric Fish. Take the 
picture before doing anything else.
Missable.Point at which you missed it: As soon as you succeed in throwing the Electric Fish into Shingalas mouth.

Missable.Name: Doctor Jaming
Missable.Description:
The boss of chapter 4 will be Doctor Jaming and a few controlled Shigura. 
Doctor Jaming will be circling overhead as you attempt to knock him out of 
the air. Take the pic before you beat him.
Missable.Point at which you missed it: As soon as you beat him.

Missable.Name: Symbol of Luna Lab
Missable.Description:
Completing Veniccios Georama to 100% will restore The Symbol of Luna Lab, a 
large construct atop the central lab. Visit the lab and take a pic of it.
Missable.Point at which you missed it: When you complete chapter 7.

Missable.Name: Fire Squall
Missable.Description:
When you reach the top of Mt Gundor, you'll see the Fire Squall to the 
left. Take a picture before you plant the bomb you get from the future. 
(destroying it will also miss the idea 'Cinders'. See Ideas section for 
more info)
Missable.Point at which you missed it: As soon as you plant the bomb.

Missable.Name: The Ultimate Gaspard
Missable.Description:
When you reach the base of the volcano, take a picture of the transformed 
Gaspard.
Missable.Point at which you missed it: As soon as you beat him.

Missable.Name: Paznos
Missable.Description:
Completing Heim Radas Georama to 100% will restore Paznos, the rebel 
fortress. Take a pic of it.
Missable.Point at which you missed it: When you complete chapter 7.

Missable.Name: Ixion
Missable.Description:
Moon Flower Palace Stop is the first opportunity to take a picture of the 
Ixion, the time travelling train, but you have any time during chapters 6 
and 7 to get a picture.
Missable.Point at which you missed it: When you complete chapter 7, you go back to using Blackstone One.

Missable.Name: Griffons Real Face
Missable.Description:
Chapter 6 has a boss fight at the beginning rather than at the end. That 
fight is with Griffon. Take a picture of him during the battle.
Missable.Point at which you missed it: As soon as you beat him.

Missable.Name: Kazarov Stonehenge
Missable.Description:
Take a picture of the central monument in Kazarov Stonehenge. You visit 
here early in chapter 6.
Missable.Point at which you missed it: When you complete chapter 7, you can no longer visit the Stonehenge.

Missable.Name: Moon Flower Palace
Missable.Description:
You need to take a picture of the front doors of the Palace. You can do 
this at the start of chapter 6 or any time during chapter 7.
Missable.Point at which you missed it: When you complete chapter 7, the Palace can't be visited again.

Missable.Name: Gigantor Paznos
Missable.Description:
After the cool cutscenes with the Chrono Union at the end of chapter 6, you 
can see Gigantor Paznos. You'll start right next to Ixion. Just run back 
toward the Stonehenge a bit, then turn around and take a picture of 
Gigantor Paznos.
Missable.Point at which you missed it: When you complete chapter 7.

Missable.Name: Flower of the Sun
Missable.Description:
The split path on the dungeon floor map for Moon Flower Palace leads to a 
dead end, where you'll find a Flower Garden. Here, you will locate the 
Flower of the Sun. An item needed for the dungeon floor 'Alexandras Room'. 
Take a pic of it before picking it up, or after placing it in Alexandras 
Room.
Missable.Point at which you missed it: When you complete Chapter 7.

Missable.Name: Sun Chamber Gatekeeper
Missable.Description:
The last floor contains a large golden gate, guarded by a Gargoyle. Take a 
pic of the Gargoyle before answering it's question.
Missable.Point at which you missed it: When you complete chapter 7.

Missable.Name: Legend of the Moon
Missable.Description:
During the final story boss at the end of chapter 7, you'll see the Moon of 
Destruction in the sky. Get a picture of it. Just watch out for Dark 
Elements attacks.
Missable.Point at which you missed it: When you beat Dark Element.

Missable.Name: Flotsam Revived
Missable.Description:
When you reach this floor, you'll meet your old pal Flotsam, who's after 
some of that sweet revenge. Take a pic of his new look before you beat him.
Missable.Point at which you missed it: When you beat him.

Description: Used to feed and raise fish
Prevents Petrification when in Active Item Slot. Eventually breaks
Fully restores HP to both Max and Monica
Prevents Curse when in Active Item Slot. Eventually breaks
Prevents Poison when in Active Item Slot. Eventually breaks
Prevents Goo when in Active Item Slot. Eventually breaks
Cures Curse Condition and Throwable weapon against Undead.
Prevents Stop when in Active Item Slot. Eventually breaks
Increases attack power for a short time

Allows escape from dungeon while monsters are still present without 
sacrificing half your money

Revives incapacitated character. Happens automatically if placed in Active 
Item
Opens locked chests without worrying about traps
